intro: Paracalia pentamera, commonly known as the star-shaped bulbous plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its clustered, bulbous stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. It prefers well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid climates.
